title: Dokken - Remastered(3x Rock Candy 2014 and 4xSHM-CD 2009)
description:
Dokken - Remastered(3x Rock Candy 2014 and 4xSHM-CD 2009) What we got......	


3x Rock Candy Collector Editions
Remastered & Reloaded 2014

and

4x SHM-CD Japan Remastered Limited Editions 2009



7 Albums:

(1983) Breaking The Chains (Rock Candy Remaster 2014)
(1984) Tooth And Nail (Rock Candy Remaster 2014)
(1985) Under Lock And Key (Rock Candy Remaster 2014)

(1983) Breaking The Chains (SHM-CD Japan 2009)
(1984) Tooth And Nail (SHM-CD Japan 2009)
(1985) Under Lock And Key (SHM-CD Japan 2009)
(1987) Back For The Attack (SHM-CD Japan 2009)

NOTE:

All albums are at 320 CBR besides 'Breaking The Chains' from Rock Candy,
which is at VBR V0


(These Classic Albums) Line-Up:

Don Dokken - Vocals (Guitars)
George Lynch Guitars (Lead & Rhythm)
Mick Brown Drums (Backing Vocals)
Jeff Pilson Bass, Keyboards (Backing Vocals)

Juan Croucier Bass, (Backing Vocals) (on 'Breaking The Chains' )


NOTE:

All albums are at 320 CBR besides 'Breaking The Chains' from Rock Candy,
which is at VBR V0


(These Classic Albums) Line-Up:

Don Dokken - Vocals (Guitars)
George Lynch Guitars (Lead & Rhythm)
Mick Brown Drums (Backing Vocals)
Jeff Pilson Bass, Keyboards (Backing Vocals)

Juan Croucier Bass, (Backing Vocals) (on 'Breaking The Chains' )


Band & Album Description:

Dokken is an American hard rock band
(with some heavy metal & glam rock influences)
that was formed Los Angeles, California back in 1977/'78.
The group accumulated numerous charting singles and
has sold more than 10 million albums worldwide.

Dokken was composed of founder Don Dokken on vocals,
George Lynch on lead guitars, Juan Croucier on bass,
and "Wild" Mick Brown on drums.
In 1983 Croucier left Dokken in order to join Ratt
and was replaced by Jeff Pilson.

1984 became Dokken's breakout year in the US with the
release of the album Ã¢â‚¬Å“Tooth and NailÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ on September 13.
The album contained several hit songs including
"Just Got Lucky", "Alone Again", and "Into The Fire".
The album sold over one million copies in the US alone
and peaked at #49, while selling an estimated three
million copies worldwide.

On November 9, 1985, the band's album Ã¢â‚¬Å“Under Lock and KeyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
was released. It also sold over one million copies with the
singles "In My Dreams" (#24), "The Hunter" (#25) and "It's Not Love"

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Back for the AttackÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ was released on November 27, 1987.
It spawned the singles "Burning Like a Flame" (#20),
"Heaven Sent" and "Kiss of Death" to become the band's most
successful release, reaching #13 on U.S. charts.

About these remastered albums can be said a lot,
whether you like it or not, maybe you prefer Vinyl,
the original CD or any other different version...
Take a listen and judge yourself!
